dataset.title: DEEP Bureau of Water Protection and Land Reuse Lake Surveys, 1997-2009

creator.organizationName: CT DEEP Bureau of Water Protection and Land Reuse

abstract.para: This database includes a survey of Connecticut lakes and reservoirs from 1997 to 2009. Parameters include water chemistry (e.g., N, P, C), heavy metals, herbicides, pH, alkalinity, TSS, Secchi depths, etc.

intellectualRights.para: This information is released to the public under the Creative Commons license CC0 1.0 Universal (https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/) and may be used for academic, educational, or commercial purposes subject to the following restrictions: The Data User must realize that these data sets are being actively used by others for ongoing research and that coordination may be necessary to prevent duplicate publication. The Data User is urged to contact the data creators or contacts. Where appropriate, the Data User may be encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators. The Data User must realize that the data may be misinterpreted if taken out of context. The Data User must acknowledge use of the data by an appropriate citation (suggested format includes the DOI). While substantial efforts are made to ensure the accuracy of data and documentation, complete accuracy of data sets cannot be guaranteed. All data are made available "as is". The creators shall not be liable for damages resulting from any use or misinterpretation of data sets. Data users should be aware that we periodically update data sets. By using these data, the Data User agrees to abide by the terms of this agreement. Thank you for your cooperation.

contact.organizationName: CT DEEP Bureau of Water Protection and Land Reuse

section.title: Water sample time
section.para: Samplings occurred from January-December, though most were samples were collected May-September

section.title: Lab Analyses
section.para: Ammonia Nitrogen: EPA 350.1 (1999-2009), EPA 353.2 (1 sample in 2004, 1 sample in 2007), EPA 350.1
ANC acid neutralizing capacity: no method reported
Organic Carbon, Total: Oxidation (2 samples from 2000), SW846 9060 (2003), EPA 415.1 (2003-2008)
Chlorophyll-a Plankton: AERP 12 (2000-2003), Fluorescence (2003-2004), EPA 300.2 (4 samples in 2003), EPA 445.0 (2005-2009)
Hardness, Total (as CaCO3): EPA 200.7 (5 samples in 2004), Std. Meth./SM 2340B (2003-2004)
Magnesium, Total: EPA 200.7 (2000-2009), ICP-OES (3 samples from 2003), EPA 6010B (2005-2007)
Organic Nitrogen: EPA 351.1 (1999-2002), EPA 353.2 (2 samples from 2000), Calculation (2005-2009)

Nitrogen, Total: EPA 353.2 (2003-2009), EPA 353.23 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.24 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.25 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.26 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.27(1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.28 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.29 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.30 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.31 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.32 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.33 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.34 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.35 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.36 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.37 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.38 (1 sample from 2009), EPA 353.39 (1 sample from 2009)
Orthophosphate: EPA 365.1 (2002-2009), EPA 365.3 (5 samples from 2003), EPA 365.5 (2003)
Solids, Total Suspended: EPA 160.2 (1999-2009), Std. Meth. 2540D (4 samples in 2004)

samplingDescription.para: Lakes were sampled from Jan-Dec, but most samples were collected from May-Sept
